events.description: A widespread sell-off in technology stocks globally that impacted investor sentiment in China.
The Shanghai Composite index fell 0.9% to below 4,070 on Thursday.

facts.fact_text: The Shanghai Composite fell 0.9% to below 4,070, while the Shenzhen Component dropped 1.4% to 13,955 on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: The Shanghai Composite fell 0.9% to below 4,070, while the Shenzhen Component dropped 1.4% to 13,955 on Thursday

facts.fact_text: Resource-linked firms including Zijin Mining, Hunan Gold Corp, and CMOC Group saw sharp losses.

evidences.evidence_text: sharp losses from Zijin Mining (-5.2%), Hunan Gold Corp (-9.9%), and CMOC Group (-6.3%)

facts.fact_text: Clean energy stocks such as Goldwind Science, Contemporary Amperex, and Sungrow Power declined.

evidences.evidence_text: Other notable decliners include clean energy stocks such as Goldwind Science (-7.9%), Contemporary Amperex (-2%) and Sungrow Power (-4.8%)

claims.claim_text: Investors shied away from tech shares due to concerns over lofty valuations and heavy AI spending.

evidences.evidence_text: Investors shied away from tech shares amid concerns over lofty valuations, heavy AI spending, and potential disruption to traditional software business models

claims.claim_text: The global tech rout weighed on market sentiment in China.

evidences.evidence_text: ending a two-day rally as a global tech rout weighed on sentiment

evidence.evidence_text: ending a two-day rally as a global tech rout weighed on sentiment
Resource-linked firms also faced renewed selling pressure as precious metals retreated
Investors shied away from tech shares amid concerns over lofty valuations, heavy AI spending
